                                  19          § 100903.        Solid waste disposal operations
                                  20            (a) IN GENERAL—To protect the air, land, water, and natural and cul-
                                  21          tural values of the System and the property of the United States in the Sys-
                                  22          tem, no solid waste disposal site (including any site for the disposal of do-
                                  23          mestic or industrial solid waste) may be operated within the boundary of
                                  24          any System unit, other than—
                                  25                  (1) a site that was operating as of September 1, 1984; or
                                  26                  (2) a site used only for disposal of waste generated within that Sys-
                                  27               tem unit so long as the site will not degrade any of the natural or cul-
                                  28               tural resources of the System unit.
                                  29            (b) REGULATIONS.—The Secretary shall prescribe regulations to carry
                                  30          out this section, including reasonable regulations to mitigate the adverse ef-
                                  31          fects of solid waste disposal sites in operation as of September 1, 1984, on
                                  32          property of the United States.

                                  36          § 100905. Commercial filming
                                  37            (a) COMMERCIAL FILMING FEE.—
                                  38                  (1) IN     GENERAL.—The          Secretary shall require a permit and shall es-
                                  39               tablish a reasonable fee for commercial filming activities or similar




                                  40               projects in a System unit. The fee shall provide a fair return to the
                                  41               United States and shall be based on the following criteria:


                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                            30
                                    1                         (A) The number of days the filming activity or similar project
                                    2                       takes place in the System unit.
                                    3                         (B) The size of the film crew present in the System unit.
                                    4                         (C) The amount and type of equipment present in the System
                                    5                       unit.
                                    6                 (2) OTHER          FACTORS.—The           Secretary may include other factors in
                                    7              determining an appropriate fee as the Secretary considers necessary.
                                    8           (b) RECOVERY            OF   COSTS.—The Secretary shall collect any costs incurred
                                    9         as a result of filming activities or similar projects, including administrative
                                  10          and personnel costs. All costs recovered shall be in addition to the fee as-
                                  11          sessed in subsection (a).
                                  12            (c) STILL PHOTOGRAPHY.—
                                  13                  (1) IN        GENERAL.—Except             as provided in paragraph (2), the Sec-
                                  14               retary shall not require a permit or assess a fee for still photography
                                  15               in a System unit if the photography takes place where members of the
                                  16               public are generally allowed. The Secretary may require a permit, as-
                                  17               sess a fee, or both, if the photography takes place at other locations
                                  18               where members of the public are generally not allowed, or where addi-
                                  19               tional administrative costs are likely.
                                  20                  (2) EXCEPTION.—The Secretary shall require and shall establish a
                                  21               reasonable fee for still photography that uses models or props that are
                                  22               not a part of the site’s natural or cultural resources or administrative
                                  23               facilities.
                                  24            (d) PROTECTION               OF   RESOURCES.—The Secretary shall not permit any
                                  25          filming, still photography or other related activity if the Secretary deter-
                                  26          mines that—
                                  27                  (1) there is a likelihood of resource damage;
                                  28                  (2) there would be an unreasonable disruption of the public’s use
                                  29               and enjoyment of the site; or
                                  30                  (3) the activity poses health or safety risks to the public.
                                  31            (e) USE      OF     PROCEEDS.—
                                  32                  (1) FEES.—All fees collected under this section shall be available for
                                  33               expenditure by the Secretary, without further appropriation and shall
                                  34               remain available until expended.
                                  35                  (2) COSTS.—All costs recovered under this section shall be available
                                  36               for expenditure by the Secretary, without further appropriation, at the
                                  37               site where the costs are collected and shall remain available until ex-
                                  38               pended.
                                  39            (f) PROCESSING           OF   PERMIT APPLICATIONS.—The Secretary shall estab-




                                  40          lish a process to ensure that the Secretary responds in a timely manner to
                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                          31
                                    1         permit applicants for commercial filming, still photography, or other activ-
                                    2         ity.
                                    3         § 100906. Advisory committees
                                    4            (a) ESTABLISHMENT.—To facilitate the administration of the System, the
                                    5         Secretary, under such terms and conditions as the Secretary may consider
                                    6         advisable, may appoint and establish advisory committees in regard to the
                                    7         functions of the Service as the Secretary considers advisable.
                                    8            (b) CHARTER EXCEPTION ON RENEWAL.—Section 14(b) of the Federal
                                    9         Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.) is waived with respect to any advi-
                                  10          sory commission or advisory committee established by law in connection
                                  11          with any System unit during the period for which the commission or com-
                                  12          mittee is authorized by law.
                                  13             (c) SERVICE     OF    MEMBERS.—Any member of any advisory commission or
                                  14          advisory committee established in connection with any System unit may
                                  15          serve after the expiration of the member’s term until a successor is ap-
                                  16          pointed.
                                  17             (d) COMPENSATION          AND     TRAVEL EXPENSES.—Members of an advisory
                                  18          committee established under subsection (a) shall receive no compensation
                                  19          for their services as such but shall be allowed necessary travel expenses as
                                  20          authorized by section 5703 of title 5.

                                    1         § 101102. Authority to accept and use funds to consolidate

                                  14           Subchapter II—National Park Foundation
                                  15          § 101111. Purpose and establishment of Foundation
                                  16            To encourage private gifts of real and personal property, or any income
                                  17          from, or other interest in, the property, for the benefit of, or in connection
                                  18          with, the Service, its activities, or its services, and thereby to further the
                                  19          conservation of natural, scenic, historic, scientific, educational, inspirational,
                                  20          or recreational resources for future generations of Americans, there is estab-
                                  21          lished a charitable and nonprofit corporation to be known as the National
                                  22          Park Foundation to accept and administer those gifts.
                                  23          § 101112. Board
                                  24            (a) MEMBERSHIP.—The National Park Foundation shall consist of a
                                  25          Board having as members the Secretary, the Director, and no fewer than
                                  26          6 private citizens of the United States appointed by the Secretary.
                                  27            (b) TERM      OF   OFFICE     AND    VACANCIES.—The term of the private citizen
                                  28          members of the Board is 6 years. If a successor is chosen to fill a vacancy
                                  29          occurring prior to the expiration of a term, the successor shall be chosen
                                  30          only for the remainder of that term.
                                  31            (c) CHAIRMAN           AND   SECRETARY.—The Secretary shall be the Chairman
                                  32          of the Board and the Director shall be the Secretary of the Board.
                                  33            (d) BOARD MEMBERSHIP NOT                  AN    OFFICE.—Membership on the Board
                                  34          shall not be an office within the meaning of the statutes of the United
                                  35          States.
                                  36            (e) QUORUM.—A majority of the members of the Board serving at any
                                  37          time shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.
                                  38            (f) SEAL.—The National Park Foundation shall have an official seal,
                                  39          which shall be judicially noticed.





                                  40            (g) MEETINGS.—The Board shall meet at the call of the Chairman and
                                  41          there shall be at least one meeting each year.

                                    1           (h) COMPENSATION             AND    REIMBURSEMENT.—No compensation shall be
                                    2         paid to the members of the Board for their services as members, but they
                                    3         shall be reimbursed for actual and necessary traveling and subsistence ex-
                                    4         penses incurred by them in the performance of their duties as members out

                                    7         § 101113. Gifts, devises, or bequests
                                    8           (a) AUTHORITY TO ACCEPT GIFTS, DEVISES,                       OR   BEQUESTS.—
                                    9                  (1) IN     GENERAL.—The          National Park Foundation may accept, re-
                                  10               ceive, solicit, hold, administer, and use any gifts, devises, or bequests,
                                  11               either absolutely or in trust of real or personal property, or any income
                                  12               from, or other interest in, the gift, devise, or bequest, for the benefit
                                  13               of, or in connection with, the Service, its activities, or its services.
                                  14                   (2) GIFT,        DEVISE,      OR    BEQUEST         THAT     IS   ENCUMBERED,        RE-
                                  15               STRICTED, OR SUBJECT TO BENEFICIAL INTERESTS.—A                              gift, devise, or
                                  16               bequest may be accepted by the National Park Foundation even though
                                  17               it is encumbered, restricted, or subject to beneficial interests of private
                                  18               persons if any current or future interest in the gift, devise, or bequest
                                  19               is for the benefit of the Service, its activities, or its services.
                                  20            (b) WHEN GIFT, DEVISE,               OR   BEQUEST MAY NOT BE ACCEPTED.—The
                                  21          National Park Foundation may not accept any gift, devise, or bequest that
                                  22          entails any expenditure other than from the resources of the Foundation.
                                  23            (c) INTEREST       IN    REAL PROPERTY.—For purposes of this section, an in-
                                  24          terest in real property includes easements or other rights for preservation,
                                  25          conservation, protection, or enhancement by and for the public of natural,
                                  26          scenic, historic, scientific, educational, inspirational, or recreational re-
                                  27          sources.
                                  28          § 101114. Disposition of property or income
                                  29            (a) AUTHORITY TO DISPOSE                  OR   DEAL WITH PROPERTY               OR     INCOME.—
                                  30          Except as otherwise required by the instrument of transfer, the National
                                  31          Park Foundation may sell, lease, invest, reinvest, retain, or otherwise dis-
                                  32          pose of or deal with any property or income from the property as the Board
                                  33          may determine.
                                  34            (b) RESTRICTION.—The National Park Foundation shall not engage in
                                  35          any business or make any investment that may not lawfully be made by a
                                  36          trust company in the District of Columbia, except that the Foundation may
                                  37          make any investment authorized by the instrument of transfer, and may re-
                                  38          tain any property accepted by the Foundation.
                                  39            (c) USE      OF   SERVICES     AND     FACILITIES      OF THE      DEPARTMENTS           OF THE
                                  40          INTERIOR      AND   JUSTICE.—The National Park Foundation may utilize the
                                  41          services and facilities of the Department of the Interior and the Department

                                    1         of Justice, and the services and facilities may be made available on request

                                    9           (a) PERPETUAL SUCCESSION.—The National Park Foundation shall have

                                    7                   Subchapter I—General Provisions
                                    8         § 101301. Maintenance management system
                                    9           The Service shall implement a maintenance management system in the
                                  10          maintenance and operations programs of the System. The system shall in-
                                  11          clude the following elements:
                                  12                  (1) A workload inventory of assets including detailed information
                                  13               that quantifies for all assets (including buildings, roads, utility systems,
                                  14               and grounds that must be maintained) the characteristics affecting the
                                  15               type of maintenance work performed.
                                  16                  (2) A set of maintenance tasks that describe the maintenance work
                                  17               in each System unit.
                                  18                  (3) A description of work standards including—
                                  19                          (A) frequency of maintenance;
                                  20                          (B) measurable quality standard to which assets should be
                                  21                        maintained;
                                  22                          (C) methods for accomplishing work;
                                  23                          (D) required labor, equipment, and material resources; and
                                  24                          (E) expected worker production for each maintenance task.
                                  25                  (4) A work program and performance budget that develops an an-




                                  26               nual work plan identifying maintenance needs and financial resources
                                  27               to be devoted to each maintenance task.



                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                           37
                                    1                 (5) A work schedule that identifies and prioritizes tasks to be done
                                    2              in a specific time period and specifies required labor resources.
                                    3                 (6) Work orders specifying job authorizations and a record of work
                                    4              accomplished that can be used to record actual labor and material
                                    5              costs.
                                    6                 (7) Reports and special analyses that compare planned versus actual
                                    7              accomplishments and costs and that can be used to evaluate mainte-
                                    8              nance operations.
                                    9         § 101302. Authority of Secretary to carry out certain activi-
                                  10                         ties
                                  11            (a) IN GENERAL.—To facilitate the administration of the System, the
                                  12          Secretary, under such terms and conditions as the Secretary may consider
                                  13          advisable, may carry out the activities described in this section.
                                  14            (b) TRANSPORTATION.—The Secretary may provide transportation of em-
                                  15          ployees located at an isolated area of the System and to members of their
                                  16          families, if—
                                  17                  (1) the area is not adequately served by commercial transportation;
                                  18               and
                                  19                  (2) the transportation is incidental to official transportation services.
                                  20            (c) RECREATION FACILITIES, EQUIPMENT,                         AND     SERVICES.—The Sec-
                                  21          retary may provide recreation facilities, equipment, and services for use by
                                  22          employees and their families located at an isolated area of the System.
                                  23            (d) FIELD       AND     SPECIAL PURPOSE EQUIPMENT.—The Secretary may
                                  24          purchase field and special purpose equipment required by employees for the
                                  25          performance of assigned functions. The purchased equipment shall be re-
                                  26          garded and listed as System equipment.
                                  27            (e) MEALS       AND    LODGING.—The Secretary may provide meals and lodg-
                                  28          ing, as the Secretary considers appropriate, for members of the United
                                  29          States Park Police and other employees of the Service, as the Secretary may
                                  30          designate, serving temporarily on extended special duty in System units. For
                                  31          this purpose the Secretary may use funds appropriated for the expenses of
                                  32          the Department of the Interior.
                                  33          § 101303. Medical attention for employees
                                  34            (a) IN GENERAL.—In the administration of the Service, the Secretary

                                  38            (b) EMPLOYEES LOCATED                 AT      ISOLATED SITUATIONS.—The Secretary

                                    6               Subchapter II—Service Career
                                    7          Development, Training, and Management
                                    8         § 101321. Service employee training
                                    9           The Secretary shall develop a comprehensive training program for em-
                                  10          ployees in all professional careers in the workforce of the Service for the
                                  11          purpose of ensuring that the workforce has available the best up-to-date
                                  12          knowledge, skills, and abilities with which to manage, interpret, and protect
                                  13          the resources of the System.
                                  14          § 101322. Management development and training
                                  15            The Secretary shall maintain a clear plan for management training and
                                  16          development under which career professional Service employees from any
                                  17          appropriate academic field may obtain sufficient training, experience, and
                                  18          advancement opportunity to enable those qualified to move into System unit
                                  19          management positions, including the position of superintendent of a System
                                  20          unit.
                                  21              Subchapter III—Housing Improvement
                                  22          § 101331. Definitions
                                  23            In this subchapter:
                                  24                    (1) FIELD       EMPLOYEE.—The          term ‘‘field employee’’ means—
                                  25                          (A) an employee of the Service who is exclusively assigned by
                                  26                        the Service to perform duties at a field unit, and the members of
                                  27                        the employee’s family; and
                                  28                          (B) any other individual who is authorized to occupy Federal
                                  29                        Government quarters under section 5911 of title 5, and for whom
                                  30                        there is no feasible alternative to the provision of Federal Govern-
                                  31                        ment housing, and the members of the individual’s family.
                                  32                    (2) PRIMARY       RESOURCE VALUES.—The                term ‘‘primary resource val-
                                  33                  ues’’ means resources that are specifically mentioned in the enabling
                                  34                  legislation for that field unit or other resource value recognized under
                                  35                  Federal statute.
                                  36                    (3) QUARTERS.—The term ‘‘quarters’’ means quarters owned or
                                  37                  leased by the Federal Government.
                                  38                    (4) SEASONAL        QUARTERS.—The            term ‘‘seasonal quarters’’ means
                                  39                  quarters typically occupied by field employees who are hired on assign-




                                  40                  ments of 6 months or less.

                                    1         § 101332. General authority of Secretary
                                    2           (a) RENTAL HOUSING.—To enhance the ability of the Secretary, acting
                                    3         through the Director, to effectively manage System units, the Secretary may
                                    4         where necessary and justified—
                                    5                 (1) make available employee housing, on or off land under the ad-
                                    6              ministrative jurisdiction of the Service; and
                                    7                 (2) rent that housing to field employees at rates based on the reason-
                                    8              able value of the housing in accordance with requirements applicable
                                    9              under section 5911 of title 5.
                                  10            (b) JOINT DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY.—The Secretary may use authori-
                                  11          ties granted by statute in combination with one another in the furtherance
                                  12          of providing where necessary and justified affordable field employee housing.
                                  13            (c) CONSTRUCTION LIMITATIONS                   ON   FEDERAL LAND.—The Secretary
                                  14          may not utilize any land for the purposes of providing field employee hous-
                                  15          ing under this subchapter that will affect a primary resource value of the
                                  16          area or adversely affect the mission of the Service.
                                  17            (d) RENTAL RATES.—To the extent practicable, the Secretary shall estab-
                                  18          lish rental rates for all quarters occupied by field employees of the Service
                                  19          that are based on the reasonable value of the quarters in accordance with
                                  20          requirements applicable under section 5911 of title 5.
                                  21          § 101333. Criteria for providing housing
                                  22            The Secretary shall maintain criteria under which housing is provided to
                                  23          employees of the Service. The Secretary shall examine the criteria with re-
                                  24          spect to the circumstances under which the Service requires an employee to
                                  25          occupy Federal Government quarters, so as to provide necessary services or
                                  26          protect Federal Government property or because of a lack of availability of
                                  27          non-Federal housing in a geographic area.
                                  28          § 101334. Authorization for housing agreements
                                  29            The Secretary may, pursuant to the authorities contained in this sub-
                                  30          chapter and subject to the appropriation of necessary funds in advance,
                                  31          enter into housing agreements with housing entities under which the hous-
                                  32          ing entities may develop, construct, rehabilitate, or manage housing, located
                                  33          on or off public land, for rent to Service employees who meet the housing
                                  34          eligibility criteria developed by the Secretary pursuant to this subchapter.

                                  12          § 101336. Contracts for the management of field employee

                                  14            Subject to the appropriation of necessary funds in advance, the Secretary

                                  19          are available to field employees.
                                  20          § 101337. Leasing of seasonal employee quarters
                                  21            (a) GENERAL AUTHORITY.—The Secretary may lease quarters at or near
                                  22          a System unit for use as seasonal quarters for field employees if the Sec-
                                  23          retary finds that there is a shortage of adequate and affordable seasonal
                                  24          quarters at or near the System unit and that—
                                  25                  (1) the requirement for the seasonal field employee quarters is tem-
                                  26               porary; or
                                  27                  (2) leasing would be more cost-effective than construction of new
                                  28               seasonal field employee quarters.
                                  29            (b) RENT.—The rent charged to field employees under the lease shall be
                                  30          a rate based on the reasonable value of the quarters in accordance with re-
                                  31          quirements applicable under section 5911 of title 5.
                                  32            (c) UNRECOVERED COSTS.—The Secretary may pay the unrecovered
                                  33          costs of leasing seasonal quarters under this section from annual appropria-
                                  34          tions for the year in which the lease is made.
                                  35          § 101338. General leasing provisions
                                  36            (a) EXEMPTION FROM LEASING REQUIREMENTS.—Section 102901 of

                                  39            (b) PROCEEDS FROM LEASES.—The proceeds from any lease under sec-




                                  40          tion 101335(a)(1) of this title and any lease under section 101337 of this
                                                HR 1068 IH

                                    1         title shall be retained by the Service and deposited in the special fund estab-
                                    2         lished for maintenance and operation of quarters.
                                    3         § 101339. Assessment and priority listing
                                    4           The Secretary shall—
                                    5                 (1) complete a condition assessment for all field employee housing,
                                    6              including the physical condition of the housing and the necessity and
                                    7              suitability of the housing for carrying out the mission of the Service,
                                    8              using existing information; and
                                    9                 (2) develop a Service-wide priority listing, by structure, identifying
                                  10               the units in greatest need for repair, rehabilitation, replacement, or ini-
                                  11               tial construction.

                                    3                       Subchapter II—Roads and Trails
                                    4         § 101511. Authority of Secretary
                                    5           (a) ROADS        AND     TRAILS     IN   SYSTEM UNITS.—The Secretary may con-
                                    6         struct, reconstruct, and improve roads and trails, including bridges, in Sys-
                                    7         tem units.
                                    8           (b) APPROACH ROADS.—
                                    9                 (1) IN    GENERAL.—

                                  10                          (A) DESIGNATION.—When the Secretary determines it to be in
                                  11                        the public interest, the Secretary may designate, as System unit
                                  12                        approach roads, roads whose primary value is to carry System unit
                                  13                        travel and that lead across land at least 90 percent owned by the
                                  14                        Federal Government and that will connect the highways within a
                                  15                        System unit with a convenient point on or leading to the National
                                  16                        Highway System.
                                  17                          (B) LIMIT     ON LENGTH OF APPROACH ROADS.—

                                  18                               (i) IN   GENERAL.—A           designated approach road shall not ex-
                                  19                            ceed—
                                  20                                      (I) 60 miles in length between a System unit gateway
                                  21                                    and a point on or leading to the nearest convenient Na-
                                  22                                    tional Highway System road; or
                                  23                                      (II) 30 miles in length if the approach road is on the
                                  24                                    National Highway System.
                                  25                               (ii) COUNTY       LIMIT.—Not        to exceed 40 miles of any one ap-
                                  26                            proach road shall be designated in any one county.
                                  27                          (C) SUPPLEMENTARY                PART OF SYSTEM UNIT HIGHWAY SYS-
                                  28                        TEM.—An      approach road designated for a System unit shall be
                                  29                        treated as a supplementary part of the highway system of the Sys-
                                  30                        tem unit.
                                  31                  (2) CONSTRUCTION,             RECONSTRUCTION, AND IMPROVEMENT.—

                                  32                          (A) IN     GENERAL.—The            Secretary may construct, reconstruct,
                                  33                        and improve approach roads designated under paragraph (1) (in-
                                  34                        cluding bridges) and enter into agreements for the maintenance of
                                  35                        the approach roads by State or county authorities or to maintain
                                  36                        the approach roads when otherwise necessary.
                                  37                          (B) ANNUAL       ALLOCATION.—Not              more than $1,500,000 shall be
                                  38                        allocated annually for the construction, reconstruction, and im-
                                  39                        provement of System unit approach roads.





                                  40                  (3) APPROVAL          OF SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE REQUIRED.—When
                                  41               an approach road is proposed under this section across or within any
                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                            46
                                    1                national forest, the Secretary shall secure the approval of the Secretary
                                    2                of Agriculture before construction begins.
                                    3           (c) AGREEMENT WITH SECRETARY                      OF   TRANSPORTATION.—Under agree-
                                    4         ment with the Secretary, the Secretary of Transportation may carry out any
                                    5         provision of this section.
                                    6         § 101512.        Conveyance to States of roads leading to certain
                                    7                         historical areas
                                    8           (a) DEFINITION.—In this section, the term ‘‘State’’ means a State, Puer-
                                    9         to Rico, Guam, and the Virgin Islands.
                                  10            (b) AUTHORITY           OF    SECRETARY.—The Secretary may, subject to condi-
                                  11          tions as seem proper to the Secretary, convey by proper quitclaim deed to
                                  12          any State, county, municipality, or agency of a State, county, or munici-
                                  13          pality in which the road is located, all right, title, and interest of the United
                                  14          States in and to any Federal Government owned or controlled road leading
                                  15          to any national cemetery, national military park, national historical park,
                                  16          national battlefield park, or national historic site administered by the Serv-
                                  17          ice.
                                  18            (c) NOTIFICATION             BY   STATE, AGENCY,       OR    MUNICIPALITY.—Prior to the
                                  19          delivery of any conveyance of a road under this section, the State, county,
                                  20          or municipality to which the conveyance is to be made shall notify the Sec-
                                  21          retary in writing of its willingness to accept and maintain the road.
                                  22            (d) TRANSFER            OF   JURISDICTION.—On the execution and delivery of the
                                  23          conveyance of a road under this section, any jurisdiction previously ceded
                                  24          to the United States by a State over the road is retroceded and shall vest
                                  25          in the State in which the road is located.

                                  29            (a) FORMULATION              OF    PLANS    AND    IMPLEMENTATION               OF   PROJECTS.—
                                  30          The Secretary may formulate transportation plans and implement transpor-
                                  31          tation projects where feasible pursuant to those plans for System units.
                                  32            (b) CONTRACTS, OPERATIONS,                 AND    ACQUISITIONS        FOR IMPROVEMENT OF
                                  33          ACCESS    TO    SYSTEM UNITS.—
                                  34                   (1) AUTHORITY              OF SECRETARY.—To           carry out subsection (a), the
                                  35                 Secretary may—
                                  36                          (A) contract with public or private agencies or carriers to pro-
                                  37                        vide transportation services, capital equipment, or facilities to im-
                                  38                        prove access to System units;
                                  39                          (B) operate those services directly in the absence of suitable and




                                  40                        adequate agencies or carriers;
                                                HR 1068 IH

                                                                                           47
                                    1                         (C) acquire, by purchase, lease, or agreement, capital equipment
                                    2                       for those services; and
                                    3                         (D) where necessary to carry out this subchapter, acquire, by
                                    4                       lease, purchase, donation, exchange, or transfer, land, water, or an
                                    5                       interest in land or water that is situated outside the boundary of
                                    6                       a System unit.
                                    7                  (2) SPECIFIC      PROVISIONS RELATED TO PROPERTY ACQUISITION.—

                                    8                         (A) ADMINISTRATION.—The acquired property shall be adminis-
                                    9                       tered as part of the System unit.
                                  10                          (B) ACQUISTION         OF LAND OR INTERESTS IN LAND OWNED BY
                                  11                        STATE OR POLITICAL SUBDIVISION.—Any                    land or interests in land
                                  12                        owned by a State or any of its political subdivisions may be ac-
                                  13                        quired only by donation.
                                  14                          (C) ACQUISITION         SUBJECT TO STATUTORY LIMITATIONS.—Any
                                  15                        land acquisition shall be subject to any statutory limitations on
                                  16                        methods of acquisition and appropriations as may be specifically
                                  17                        applicable to the area.
                                  18            (c) ESTABLISHMENT             OF    INFORMATION PROGRAMS.—The Secretary shall
                                  19          establish information programs to inform the public of available System unit
                                  20          access opportunities and to promote the use of transportation modes other
                                  21          than personal motor vehicles for access to and travel within the System
                                  22          units.
                                  23            (d) UNDERTAKING TRANSPORTATION FACILITIES                                 AND     SERVICES.—
                                  24          Transportation facilities and services provided pursuant to this subchapter
                                  25          may be undertaken by the Secretary directly or by contract without regard
                                  26          to any requirement of Federal, State, or local law respecting determinations
                                  27          of public convenience and necessity or other similar matters. The Secretary
                                  28          or contractor shall consult with the appropriate State or local public service
                                  29          commission or other body having authority to issue certificates of conven-
                                  30          ience and necessity. A contractor shall be subject to applicable requirements
                                  31          of that body unless the Secretary determines that the requirements would
                                  32          not be consistent with the purposes and provisions of this subchapter.
                                  33            (e) CONSTRUCTION            OF   GRANT     OF   AUTHORITY RESPECTING OPERATION

                                  36          section 13506(a)(9) of title 49.

                                  38            (a) ASSISTANCE           OF   HEADS     OF     OTHER FEDERAL DEPARTMENTS                AND
                                  39          AGENCIES        IN   FORMULATION         AND     IMPLEMENTATION.—To carry out this




                                  40          subchapter, the Secretary of Transportation, the Secretary of Housing and

                                                                                           48
                                    1         retary of Commerce, and the heads of other Federal departments or agen-

                                    4           (b) COMPILATION          OF   STATUTES         AND   PROGRAMS.—The Secretary shall

                                    8         § 101523. Procedures applicable to transportation plans and
                                    9                        projects
                                  10            (a) DURING FORMULATION                OF      PLAN.—The Secretary shall, during the
                                  11          formulation of any transportation plan authorized pursuant to section
                                  12          101521 of this title—
                                  13                  (1) give public notice of intention to formulate the plan by publica-
                                  14               tion in the Federal Register and in a newspaper or periodical having
                                  15               general circulation in the vicinity of the affected System unit; and
                                  16                  (2) following the notice, hold a public meeting at a location conven-
                                  17               ient to the affected System unit.
                                  18            (b) PRIOR      TO IMPLEMENTATION OF               PROJECT.—Prior to the implementa-
                                  19          tion of any project developed pursuant to the transportation plan formulated
                                  20          pursuant to subsection (a), the Secretary shall—
                                  21                  (1) establish procedures, including public meetings, to give State and
                                  22               local governments and the public adequate notice and an opportunity
                                  23               to comment on the proposed transportation project; and
                                  24                  (2) when the proposed project would involve an expenditure in excess
                                  25               of $100,000 in any fiscal year, submit a detailed report to the Com-
                                  26               mittee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate and the Com-
                                  27               mittee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives.
                                  28            (c) WAITING PERIOD.—When a report on a project is required under sub-
                                  29          section (b)(2), the Secretary may proceed with the implementation of the
                                  30          project only after 60 days (not counting days on which the Senate or House
                                  31          of Representatives has adjourned for more than 3 consecutive days) have
                                  32          elapsed following submission of the report.
                                  33          § 101524. Special rule for service contract to provide trans-
                                  34                         portation services
                                  35            Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a service contract entered
                                  36          into by the Secretary for the provision solely of transportation services in
                                  37          a System unit shall be not more than 10 years in length, including a base
                                  38          period of 5 years and annual extensions for up to an additional 5 years
                                  39          based on satisfactory performance and approval by the Secretary.

                                    1                                  Subchapter IV—Fees
                                    2         § 101531. Fee for use of transportation services
                                    3           Notwithstanding any other provision of law, where the Service or an enti-
                                    4         ty under a service contract, cooperative agreement, or other contractual
                                    5         agreement with the Service provides transportation to all or a portion of any
                                    6         System unit, the Secretary may impose a reasonable and appropriate charge
                                    7         to the public for the use of the transportation services in addition to any
                                    8         admission fee required to be paid. Collection of the transportation and ad-
                                    9         mission fees may occur at the transportation staging area or any other rea-
                                  10          sonably convenient location determined by the Secretary. The Secretary may
                                  11          enter into agreements, with public or private entities that qualify to the Sec-
                                  12          retary’s satisfaction, to collect the transportation and admission fee. Trans-
                                  13          portation fees collected pursuant to this section shall be retained by the Sys-
                                  14          tem unit at which the transportation fee was collected, and the amount re-
                                  15          tained shall be expended only for costs associated with the transportation
                                  16          systems at the System unit where the charge was imposed.

                                  18          § 101701. Challenge cost-share agreement authority

                                  21               cost-share agreement’’ means any agreement entered into between the
                                  22               Secretary and any cooperator for the purpose of sharing costs or serv-
                                  23               ices in carrying out authorized functions and responsibilities of the Sec-
                                  24               retary with respect to any System unit or System program, any affili-
                                  25               ated area, or any designated national scenic trail or national historic
                                  26               trail.
                                  27                  (2) COOPERATOR.—The term ‘‘cooperator’’ means any State or local
                                  28               government, public or private agency, organization, institution, corpora-
                                  29               tion, individual, or other entity.
                                  30            (b) AUTHORITY TO ENTER INTO CHALLENGE COST-SHARE AGREE-
                                  31          MENTS.—The        Secretary may negotiate and enter into challenge cost-share
                                  32          agreements with cooperators.
                                  33            (c) SOURCE       OF    FEDERAL SHARE.—In carrying out challenge cost-share
                                  34          agreements, the Secretary may provide the Federal funding share from any
                                  35          funds available to the Service.





                                  36          § 101702. Cooperative agreements
                                  37            (a) TRANSFER           OF   SERVICE APPROPRIATED FUNDS.—A cooperative
                                  38          agreement entered into by the Secretary that involves the transfer of Service

                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                            50
                                    1         appropriated funds to a State, local, or tribal government or other public
                                    2         entity, an educational institution, or a private nonprofit organization to

                                    4         properly entered into under section 6305 of title 31.
                                    5           (b) COOPERATIVE RESEARCH                  AND   TRAINING PROGRAMS.—
                                    6                 (1) IN       GENERAL.—To         facilitate the administration of the System,
                                    7              the Secretary, under such terms and conditions as the Secretary may
                                    8              consider advisable, may—
                                    9                         (A) enter into cooperative agreements with public or private
                                  10                        educational institutions, States, and political subdivisions of States
                                  11                        to develop adequate, coordinated, cooperative research and train-
                                  12                        ing programs concerning the resources of the System; and
                                  13                          (B) pursuant to an agreement, accept from and make available

                                  16                        ment, facilities, and administrative services relating to cooperative
                                  17                        research units that the Secretary considers appropriate.
                                  18                  (2) EFFECT         OF SUBSECTION.—This                subsection does not waive any
                                  19               requirements for research projects that are subject to Federal procure-
                                  20               ment regulations.
                                  21            (c) SALE      OF   PRODUCTS         AND   SERVICES PRODUCED             IN THE    CONDUCT   OF
                                  22          LIVING EXHIBITS           AND INTERPRETIVE          DEMONSTRATIONS.—To facilitate the
                                  23          administration of the System, the Secretary, under such terms and condi-
                                  24          tions as the Secretary considers advisable, may—
                                  25                  (1) sell at fair market value, without regard to the requirements of

                                  30                  (2) enter into contracts, including cooperative arrangements, with re-
                                  31               spect to living exhibits and interpretive demonstrations in System
                                  32               units; and
                                  33                  (3) credit the proceeds from those sales and contracts to the appro-
                                  34               priation bearing the cost of the exhibits and demonstrations.
                                  35            (d) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS                     FOR   SYSTEM UNIT NATURAL RESOURCE
                                  36          PROTECTION.—
                                  37                  (1) IN     GENERAL.—The             Secretary may enter into cooperative agree-
                                  38               ments with State, local, or tribal governments, other Federal agencies,
                                  39               other public entities, educational institutions, private nonprofit organi-




                                  40               zations, or participating private landowners for the purpose of pro-
                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                         51
                                    1             tecting natural resources of System units through collaborative efforts
                                    2             on land inside and outside the System units.
                                    3                (2) TERMS        AND CONDITIONS.—A           cooperative agreement entered into
                                    4             under paragraph (1) shall provide clear and direct benefits to System
                                    5             unit natural resources and—
                                    6                        (A) provide for—
                                    7                             (i) the preservation, conservation, and restoration of coastal
                                    8                          and riparian systems, watersheds, and wetlands;
                                    9                             (ii) preventing, controlling, or eradicating invasive exotic
                                  10                           species that are within a System unit or adjacent to a System
                                  11                           unit; or
                                  12                              (iii) restoration of natural resources, including native wild-
                                  13                           life habitat or ecosystems;
                                  14                         (B) include a statement of purpose demonstrating how the
                                  15                       agreement will—
                                  16                              (i) enhance science-based natural resource stewardship at
                                  17                           the System unit; and
                                  18                              (ii) benefit the parties to the agreement;
                                  19                         (C) specify any staff required and technical assistance to be pro-
                                  20                       vided by the Secretary or other parties to the agreement in sup-
                                  21                       port of activities inside and outside the System unit that will—
                                  22                              (i) protect natural resources of the System unit; and
                                  23                              (ii) benefit the parties to the agreement;
                                  24                         (D) identify any materials, supplies, or equipment and any other
                                  25                       resources that will be contributed by the parties to the agreement
                                  26                       or by other Federal agencies;
                                  27                         (E) describe any financial assistance to be provided by the Sec-
                                  28                       retary or the partners to implement the agreement;
                                  29                         (F) ensure that any expenditure by the Secretary pursuant to
                                  30                       the agreement is determined by the Secretary to support the pur-
                                  31                       poses of natural resource stewardship at a System unit; and
                                  32                         (G) include such other terms and conditions as are agreed to
                                  33                       by the Secretary and the other parties to the agreement.
                                  34                 (3) LIMITATIONS.—The Secretary shall not use any funds associated
                                  35              with an agreement entered into under paragraph (1) for the purposes
                                  36              of land acquisition, regulatory activity, or the development, mainte-
                                  37              nance, or operation of infrastructure, except for ancillary support facili-
                                  38              ties that the Secretary determines to be necessary for the completion
                                  39              of projects or activities identified in the agreement.

                                    1         § 101703.       Cooperative management agreements
                                    2           (a) IN GENERAL.—To facilitate the administration of the System, the

                                  20          ment may be for any period of time determined by the Secretary and the

                                  22          § 101704. Reimbursable agreements
                                  23            (a) IN GENERAL.—In carrying out work under reimbursable agreements
                                  24          with any State, local, or tribal government, the Secretary, without regard
                                  25          to any provision of law or a regulation—
                                  26                  (1) may record obligations against accounts receivable from those
                                  27               governments; and
                                  28                  (2) shall credit amounts received from those governments to the ap-
                                  29               propriate account.
                                  30            (b) WHEN AMOUNTS SHALL BE CREDITED.—Amounts shall be credited
                                  31          within 90 days of the date of the original request by the Service for pay-

                                  22               the best proposal for a proposed new concession contract that author-
                                  23               izes the continuation of the facilities and services provided by the con-
                                  24               cessioner under its prior contract.
                                  25          § 101912. Findings and declaration of policy
                                  26            (a) FINDINGS.—In furtherance of section 100101(a), Congress finds that
                                  27          the preservation and conservation of System unit resources and values re-
                                  28          quires that public accommodations, facilities, and services that have to be
                                  29          provided within those System units should be provided only under carefully
                                  30          controlled safeguards against unregulated and indiscriminate use, so that—
                                  31                  (1) visitation will not unduly impair those resources and values; and
                                  32                  (2) development of public accommodations, facilities, and services




                                  33               within System units can best be limited to locations that are consistent
                                  34               to the highest practicable degree with the preservation and conservation
                                  35               of the resources and values of the System units.

                                               HR 1068 IH

                                                                                           54
                                    1           (b) DECLARATION           OF   POLICY.—It is the policy of Congress that the de-
                                    2         velopment of public accommodations, facilities, and services in System units
                                    3         shall be limited to accommodations, facilities, and services that—
                                    4                 (1) are necessary and appropriate for public use and enjoyment of
                                    5              the System unit in which they are located; and
                                    6                 (2) are consistent to the highest practicable degree with the preser-
                                    7              vation and conservation of the resources and values of the System unit.
                                    8         § 101913. Award of concession contracts
                                    9           In furtherance of the findings and policy stated in section 101912 of this
                                  10          title, and except as provided by this subchapter or otherwise authorized by
                                  11          law, the Secretary shall utilize concession contracts to authorize a person,
                                  12          corporation, or other entity to provide accommodations, facilities, and serv-
                                  13          ices to visitors to System units. Concession contracts shall be awarded as
                                  14          follows:
                                  15                  (1) COMPETITIVE           SELECTION PROCESS.—Except                  as otherwise pro-
                                  16               vided in this section, all proposed concession contracts shall be awarded
                                  17               by the Secretary to the person, corporation, or other entity submitting
                                  18               the best proposal, as determined by the Secretary through a competi-
                                  19               tive selection process. The competitive process shall include simplified
                                  20               procedures for small, individually-owned entities seeking award of a
                                  21               concession contract.
                                  22                  (2) SOLICITATION          OF PROPOSALS.—Except               as otherwise provided in
                                  23               this section, prior to awarding a new concession contract (including re-
                                  24               newals or extensions of existing concession contracts) the Secretary—
                                  25                          (A) shall publicly solicit proposals for the concession contract;
                                  26                        and
                                  27                          (B) in connection with the solicitation, shall—
                                  28                                (i) prepare a prospectus and publish notice of its avail-
                                  29                              ability at least once in local or national newspapers or trade
                                  30                              publications, by electronic means, or both, as appropriate; and
                                  31                                (ii) make the prospectus available on request to all inter-
                                  32                              ested persons.
                                  33                  (3) INFORMATION               TO BE INCLUDED IN PROSPECTUS.—The                   pro-
                                  34               spectus shall include the following information:
                                  35                          (A) The minimum requirements for the contract as set forth in
                                  36                        paragraph (4).
                                  37                          (B) The terms and conditions of any existing concession con-
                                  38                        tract relating to the services and facilities to be provided, including
                                  39                        all fees and other forms of compensation provided to the United




                                  40                        States by the concessioner.
                                                HR 1068 IH

                                                                                          55
                                    1                        (C) Other authorized facilities or services that may be provided
                                    2                      in a proposal.
                                    3                        (D) Facilities and services to be provided by the Secretary to
                                    4                      the concessioner, including public access, utilities, and buildings.
                                    5                        (E) An estimate of the amount of compensation due an existing
                                    6                      concessioner from a new concessioner under the terms of a prior
                                    7                      concession contract.
                                    8                        (F) A statement as to the weight to be given to each selection
                                    9                      factor identified in the prospectus and the relative importance of
                                  10                       those factors in the selection process.
                                  11                         (G) Other information related to the proposed concession oper-
                                  12                       ation that is provided to the Secretary pursuant to a concession
                                  13                       contract or is otherwise available to the Secretary, as the Sec-
                                  14                       retary determines is necessary to allow for the submission of com-
                                  15                       petitive proposals.
                                  16                         (H) Where applicable, a description of a preferential right to
                                  17                       the renewal of the proposed concession contract held by an exist-
                                  18                       ing concessioner as set forth in paragraph (7).
                                  19                 (4) CONSIDERATION             OF PROPOSALS.—

                                  20                         (A) MINIMUM           REQUIREMENTS.—No             proposal shall be consid-
                                  21                       ered that fails to meet the minimum requirements as determined
                                  22                       by the Secretary. The minimum requirements shall include the fol-
                                  23                       lowing:
                                  24                                 (i) The minimum acceptable franchise fee or other forms
                                  25                            of consideration to the Federal Government.
                                  26                                 (ii) Any facilities, services, or capital investment required
                                  27                            to be provided by the concessioner.
                                  28                                 (iii) Measures necessary to ensure the protection, conserva-
                                  29                            tion, and preservation of resources of the System unit.
                                  30                         (B) REJECTION         OF PROPOSAL.—The             Secretary shall reject any
                                  31                       proposal, regardless of the franchise fee offered, if the Secretary
                                  32                       determines that—
                                  33                                 (i) the person, corporation, or entity is not qualified or is
                                  34                            not likely to provide satisfactory service; or
                                  35                                 (ii) the proposal is not responsive to the objectives of pro-
                                  36                            tecting and preserving resources of the System unit and of
                                  37                            providing necessary and appropriate facilities and services to
                                  38                            the public at reasonable rates.
                                  39                         (C) ALL      PROPOSALS FAIL TO MEET MIMIMUM REQUIREMENTS
                                  40                       OR ARE REJECTED.—If            all proposals submitted to the Secretary
                                  41                       fail to meet the minimum requirements or are rejected by the Sec-

                                    1                      retary, the Secretary shall establish new minimum contract re-

                                    5                      INCORPORATED IN CONTRACT.—The                     Secretary may not execute a
                                    6                      concession contract that materially amends or does not incorporate
